clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess Safety and Effectiveness of Adalimumab for Treating Children and Adolescents With Crohn's Disease in Real Life Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Long-term Safety and Effectiveness of Adalimumab for Treating Children and Adolescents With Crohn's Disease in Real Life Conditions-LEA

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate long-term effectiveness of adalimumab in pediatric participants starting a treatment for Crohn's disease in real life conditions, namely to describe the time to loss of clinical benefit in a time to event approach. Main secondary objectives are to describe growth and pubertal development and to describe long-term safety. The participants will be followed-up up to 10 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to loss of clinical benefit
primary_outcome.description: Loss of clinical benefit will be defined as one of the following: Loss of efficacy leading to adalimumab discontinuation or Introduction / reinforcement of other immunosuppressants (ratio dose/weight) or Introduction / reinforcement of corticosteroids (ratio dose/weight; reinforcement of corticosteroids are allowed within the 4 first months after start of adalimumab) Introduction of enteral nutrition CD-related surgery, discontinuation of adalimumab due to adverse event, death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with dose escalation (dose and/or frequency of injections)
secondary_outcome.description: Dosing and/or frequency of injections is monitored to assess dose escalation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median percent change from baseline in C-reactive protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: The median percent change from baseline in CRP is assessed at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median percent change from baseline in calprotectin
secondary_outcome.description: The median percent change from baseline in calprotectin us assessed at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in weighted Pediatric Crohn's Disease Activity Index (PCDAI)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pediatric Activity Index (PCDAI) has become the standard outcome measure in pediatric Crohn's disease (CD) clinical research. The Weighted Pediatric Crohn's Disease Activity Index (wPCDAI) was developed to add weight to the items in the PCDAI and make it more feasible. In the wPCDAI, growth velocity, abdominal examination, and hematocrit are removed. The wPCDAI score can range from 0-125, with higher signifying severe disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in wPCDAI >= 37.5
secondary_outcome.description: A change in wPCDAI >= 37.5 indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of CD-related hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitalization will be determined from the health care utilization information.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of clinical remission
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission is weighted PCDAI < 12.5 or Harvey-Bradshaw index (HBI) <5. Rate of clinical remission will be described at each time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants achieving mucosal healing at each time point
secondary_outcome.description: Mucosal healing is assessed using SES-CD score (0 or 1).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with steroid-free clinical remission at each time point
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants with steroid-free clinical remission is assessed at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in weight z-score
secondary_outcome.description: Growth is assessed by monitoring changes in weight z-score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median percent change from baseline in high sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: The median percent change from baseline in hs-CRP is assessed at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing Mucosal healing
secondary_outcome.description: Mucosal healing is assessed using Simple Endoscopic Score for Cronh's Disease (SES-CD) score (0 or 1).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of steroid-free remission
secondary_outcome.description: Steroid-free remission is defined as weighted PCDAI < 12.5 or HBI <5 and no daily intake of prednisone (whatever the route). Rate of steroid-free remission will be described at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with fistula remission (in participants with fistulizing CD at entry)
secondary_outcome.description: Fistula remission is defined as closure for at least 2 consecutive visits of all fistulae that were draining at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tanner's staging
secondary_outcome.description: Tanner's staging is used to assess growth and pubertal development.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with immunomodulator-free clinical remission at each time point
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants with immunomodulator-free clinical remission is assessed at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of infectious events
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence rate of serious and non-serious opportunistic infections is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of all-cause hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitalization will be determined from the health care utilization information.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with steroid tapering at each time point (steroids daily dosing lower than at baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants with steroid tapering i.e., steroids daily dosing lower than at baseline (week 0) is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in height z-score
secondary_outcome.description: Growth is assessed by monitoring changes in height z-score

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with CD-related surgery
secondary_outcome.description: CD-related surgery includes subtotal colectomy with ileorectostomy, colectomy with ileo-anal pouch, Koch pouch, ileostomy, small bowel resection, and etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of CD- or drug-related hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitalization will be determined from the health care utilization information.

arm_group.description: Pediatric participants receiving adalimumab for CD in real-life conditions.

study_pop.textblock: Participants are children and adolescents with Crohn's disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- With confirmed diagnosis of Crohn's disease
- Adalimumab-naïve patient (a patient having received an anti-TNF other than adalimumab may enter the study)
- Starting a treatment with adalimumab
- Guardian capable of and willing to grant authorization for use/disclosure of data collected and patient able to comply with the requirements of the study protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with a history of treatment with adalimumab
- Participants enrolled in a concomitant interventional clinical trial.
